Topic.Title: How do i get the .aslx files?

Posts.EditableText:
Hey,

I wanted to translate the games, but I dont know how I can get the English.aslx file from a downloaded game, can you help me guys?

Thanks for the attention!
Posts.HTML:
Hey,

I wanted to translate the games, but I dont know how I can get the English.aslx file from a downloaded game, can you help me guys?

Thanks for the attention!

Posts.EditableText: First you should ask the game author for the permission to translate his game into another language. If he agrees ask him to send you the source aslx-file of his game. Then you can exchange the language file and start to translate the text in the game file.
Posts.HTML: First you should ask the game author for the permission to translate his game into another language. If he agrees ask him to send you the source aslx-file of his game. Then you can exchange the language file and start to translate the text in the game file.

Posts.EditableText: hm... I understood, so how I can ask the game author for this permission?
Posts.HTML: hm... I understood, so how I can ask the game author for this permission?

Posts.EditableText: well... If someone want the portuguese (brazil) translation for your game, add me on skype: conrado810
Posts.HTML: well... If someone want the portuguese (brazil) translation for your game, add me on skype: conrado810

Posts.EditableText:
Hello Quest is under a MIT Licence which mean you are free to change source code https://github.com/textadventures/quest  and as for translations see http://docs.textadventures.co.uk/quest/guides/translating_quest.html  these sites will provide you more info.

Mike
